thread.section_title: About.com Business Travel: What's Hot Now
thread.title: What is Deep Vein Thrombosis?

title: What is Deep Vein Thrombosis?
text:
Airline Ticket. (Photo by Cassiopeia_sweet.) 
Definition: 
Deep vein thrombosis, or DVT, is a medical condition that can affect anyone who traveler frequently. 
DVT refers to a blood clot that forms in vein that's deep in the body, such as one in the leg or thigh. DVT have a high degree of risk, since the blood clot may break off and travel to other parts of the body and block blood flow. DVT is dangerous because thereâ€™s a chance that the blood clot that develops will break off and cause serious illness or even death. Related Articles
